message: how easily does vim stack up against this list of requirements? http://stackoverflow.com/questions/6105273/specific-ide-for-specific-things
how much is that person's estimate of "excessive configuration" accurate?
it could be setup but the way i would just use vim as the editor and another terminal for doing compiling and debuging and hprof
screen or a tabbed browser with good tab switching hotkeys is your friend.
Did anybody got vim-makegreen to work properly with nose?

sorry, for the "not-very-meaningful" & double post. The iPhone app was fooling me.

What I wanted to ask, was if somebody got vim-makegreen to work properly with nose? In my configuration (see https://github.com/nureineide/dotvim/blob/master/vimrc), it always happens, that the testrunner file of nose is opened when a testrun fails (instead of highlighting the problem area). Any ideas?
